message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.IR, cs.AI 

This paper deals with the problem of inferring a regular expression from a given set of strings, which is a natural language processing task and falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also discusses the modeling of this task as a learning problem with structured output spaces and an appropriate loss function, which is a machine learning task and falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The task of identifying regular expressions that describe email campaigns also involves the detection of spam, which is a cybersecurity task and falls under the category of cybersecurity (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the use of optimization techniques to solve the resulting optimization problem, which is a field of study in information retrieval (cs.IR) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
